column1: Biodiesel can also be used as a heating fuel in domestic and commercial boilers
column2: a mix of heating oil and biofuel which is standardized and taxed slightly differently from diesel fuel used for transportation. Bioheat fuel is a proprietary blend of biodiesel and traditional heating oil. Bioheat is a registered trademark of the National Biodiesel Board [NBB] and the National Oilheat Research Alliance [NORA] in the U.S.
column3: and Columbia Fuels in Canada. Heating biodiesel is available in various blends. ASTM 396 recognizes blends of up to 5 percent biodiesel as equivalent to pure petroleum heating oil. Blends of higher levels of up to 20% biofuel are used by many consumers. Research is underway to determine whether such blends affect performance.Older furnaces may contain rubber parts that would be affected by biodiesel's solvent properties
column4: but can otherwise burn biodiesel without any conversion required. Care must be taken
column6: given that varnishes left behind by Petro diesel will be released and can clog pipes- fuel filtering and prompt filter replacement is required.
